title: BUG: direct message from synced contact crashed node
body:
## Description
I've been getting the last few messages from folks I've sent in 1-1 chats. I tried to send one and it crashed the app

## Env Info
- code version: [current master ](https://github.com/status-im/nim-status-client/commit/599f788e672b8f251f27bfe40daf8c71a46f42cc)
- OS: PopOS! 20.04 LTS

## error output
```
DBG 2020-09-23 06:24:37-04:00 callPrivateRPC                             topics="rpc" tid=351399 file=core.nim:20 rpc_method=wakuext_sendChatMessage
Traceback (most recent call last)
/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/src/nim_status_client.nim(167) nim_status_client
/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/src/nim_status_client.nim(164) mainProc

/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/src/status/libstatus/accounts.nim(49) generateIdenticon
/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/vendor/nim-status/src/nim_status/lib.nim(45) identicon
/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/vendor/nim-status/src/nim_status/lib/identicon.nim(101) generateBase64
/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/vendor/nim-status/src/nim_status/lib/identicon.nim(90) renderBase64

/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/vendor/nimPNG/nimPNG.nim(2869) encoderCore

/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/vendor/nimPNG/nimPNG/filters.nim(289) filterBruteForce

SIGSEGV: Illegal storage access. (Attempt to read from nil?)
make: *** [Makefile:416: run-linux] Error 1
```
happened again on a current 1-1 that was already started and current from desktop
reverted to alpha.6 commit, no problems there
an attempt to send a txn (from alpha.6 commit) gave the same

an attempt to open that same chat after txn send gives the following: 
```
"There are still \"1\" items in the process of being created at engine destruction."
/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/src/nim_status_client.nim(167) nim_status_client
/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/src/nim_status_client.nim(164) mainProc

/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/core/macros.nim(566) onSlotCalled
/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/src/app/wallet/views/token_list.nim(51) rowData

/home/petty/GitHub/status-im/nim-status-client/vendor/nimbus-build-system/vendor/Nim/lib/pure/collections/tables.nim(262) []
Error: unhandled exception: key not found: decimals [KeyError]
make: *** [Makefile:416: run-linux] Error 1
```
@corpetty are you still experiencing this issue?

~~it doesn't appear so~~

Just kidding, just happened on current master on a 1-1 chat: 
```

SIGSEGV: Illegal storage access. (Attempt to read from nil?)
make: *** [Makefile:416: run-linux] Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

I'm getting this exact same error when trying to request a 1-1 transaction.
1. Go to chat
2. Click "+" for 1-1 chat commands
3. Click "Request"
4. Fill out details in the modal
5. Click the final "request" button
**Expected**: a transaction request should be sent to the recipient and appear in the chat
**Actual**: a transaction request appears in the chat, but was not actually sent. And the app crashes with the same stacktrace as above.

I tried adding a `try/except` on the `generateIdenticon` proc in `libstatus/accounts`, but it did not prevent the issue.
this has been fixed with recent changes
